name: Particles System
body:
# Particle System by Fangyi Zhu
Cross platform runnable application is in git repository. Download and play with it! I don't erase particles while switching between modes to create fun accidents.
## Features Implemented
### (15) Water Fountain 
![water](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/water.png)
### (15) Fire Simulation 
![fire](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/fire.png)
### (15) Magic Spell 
![magic](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/magic.png)
### (10) Gravity 
![gravity](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/gravity.png)
### (5) Bouncing on Floor
![bounce](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/bounce.png)
### (5) Snow
![snow](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/snow.png)
### (5) Realtime rendering
60 frames per Second.
```java
frameRate(60);
```
### (5) Interaction with obstacles
A blue box to play with, use up, down, left, right keys to move it around. Particles hit on it will bounce.
![box](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/box1.png)
![box](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/box2.png)
![box](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/box3.png)
![box](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/box4.png)
![box](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/box5.png)
### (5) Tails on particles
Particles in all modes have tails, long or short.
### (5) Translucent particles
Fire, magic, snow mode have translucent particles, fire and magic's opacity change with lifetime.
### (10) Real-time user interaction with system
### (10) Multiple interacting particle systems
By clicking the last dot on up-left, turn on mouse mode. Particles will fly away from the cursor. 
Can be played together with the blue box. When moving fast, some particles can be trapped, it's fun.
Showed in video.
### (5) Art Contest Submission
![art](https://raw.github.com/rhodon/particles/master/wiki/contest.png)
### (5) Video documenting your system and highlights features
http://youtu.be/3_HirLtTV8k

## Tools and Libraries
* Processing: http://processing.org/
* Particle system based on example: http://processing.org/

## Difficulty Encountered
In mouse mode, when mouse move too fast, some particle would stuck In the invisible circle around the mouse. But I find it actually quite interesting, so I just keep it.
